McKenzie County Public Schools is pleased to announce that every student will receive FREE meals for the start of the upcoming school year. This includes all students, no matter their income level or if they are in the classroom or taking part in distance learning.
The free meals come via funding from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), as the country continues to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic. It is an extension of the USDA Summer Food Service Program. Free meals will last through as late at December 31, 2020 or until available federal funding runs out. MCPSD is still awaiting more guidance from the USDA.
Current funds in a student account can be held for when charges resume and Grab-n-Go items, seconds and extra milk are extra cost. Families are still encouraged to fill out forms for the Free & Reduced Meal Program, as these free meals are temporary.

post_text: Moen's Kindergarten class did another PTLW Activity! This one was called Building a Beanstalk. Students were tasked with building a beanstalk as tall as they could but it had to stand on its own and they could only use 10 pipe cleaners. They then measured the height of each and tested which beanstalk could hold the most weight. The tallest was 12 inches and the beanstalk that held the most weight held 18 of the weight discs. After measuring and weighing, they discuss why some worked and others didn‚Äôt. Then they were put into groups and were to design a new beanstalk that would support a weighted Golden Egg. The stalk had to stand on its own, support the weight of the egg and the egg could not touch the table (or floor). These pictures show the final groups and their beanstalks with their golden eggs.
